channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ワーナー・ミュージック・グループがUproxx、HipHopDX、その他の資産をジャレット・マイヤー、リッチ・アントニエロ、ウィル・アイ・アムが設立した新会社Uproxx Studiosに売却（Murray Stassen/Music Business Worldwide）
item.description:
Murray Stassen / Music Business Worldwide:
Warner Music Group sells Uproxx, HipHopDX, and other assets to a new company, Uproxx Studios, formed by Jarret Myer, Rich Antoniello, and will.i.am  —  In February, Robert Kyncl - CEO of Warner Music Group - confirmed that WMG was in active discussions to sell its ‘owned and operated’ media properties UPROXX and HipHopDX.

item.title: インドのストリーミングサービス「JioCinema」が広告なしの定額プランを開始、最安層は1デバイスで月額0.35ドル、ライバルを下回る（Manish Singh/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Manish Singh / TechCrunch:
Indian streaming service JioCinema launches an ad-free subscription plan with the lowest tier costing $0.35/month for a single device, undercutting rivals  —  JioCinema, the popular Indian on-demand video streaming service, introduced a new monthly subscription plan on Thursday, with the lowest tier costing just 35 cents.

item.title: The Gateway Punditの創設者が、その親会社が連邦破産法第11章の適用を申請すると発表した。
item.description:
Will Sommer / Washington Post:
The founder of The Gateway Pundit says its parent company is filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, as it faces lawsuits claiming it promoted bogus election claims  —  Gateway Pundit, the popular far-right blog, is filing for bankruptcy as it faces lawsuits alleging it promoted bogus claims …

item.title: メタの株価が15％以上下落、第2四半期の売上予測が軽微に、AIインフラ投資の増加により2024年度の資本支出が増加（Ashley Capoot/CNBC）
item.description:
Ashley Capoot / CNBC:
Meta's stock drops 15%+ as the company issues a light Q2 revenue forecast and higher FY 2024 capital expenditures due to increased AI infrastructure investments  —  Mark Zuckerberg, CEO of Meta, testifies during the Senate Judiciary Committee hearing titled “Big Tech and the Online Child …

item.title: Apollo が支援する米投資グループ Concord が Hipgnosis Songs Fund への入札額を15億ドルに増額、Blackstone からの最後のオファーをわずかに上回る (Daniel Thomas/Financial Times)
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
Apollo-backed US investment group Concord increases its bid for Hipgnosis Songs Fund, to $1.5B, just over the last offer from Blackstone  —  Offer for music rights group rises to $1.5bn as Apollo-backed investor beats rival's bid  —  Hipgnosis Songs Fund has found itself at the centre …

item.title: メタ、2024年3月期第1四半期の売上高は前年同期比27％増の$364.6億、純利益は同117％増の$123.7億、ファミリー世帯のデイリーアクティブ人口は同7％増の32.4億人（メタ・インベスター・リレーションズ）
item.description:
Meta Investor Relations:
Meta reports Q1 revenue up 27% YoY to $36.46B, net income up 117% YoY to $12.37B, and family daily active people up 7% YoY to 3.24B for March 2024  —  Meta Platforms, Inc. (Nasdaq: META) today reported financial results for the quarter ended March 31, 2024.

item.title: TikTokはTikTok Liteのリワードプログラムを一時停止し、子供向けプログラムの潜在的な中毒性についてのEUの懸念を解決しようとしている（Foo Yun Chee/Reuters）
item.description:
Foo Yun Chee / Reuters:
TikTok is suspending the rewards program in TikTok Lite while it tries to resolve EU concerns about the potentially addictive nature of the program for children  —  TikTok will voluntarily suspend its new app TikTok Lite's reward programme while it tries to resolve EU concerns, the company said on X social media platform on Wednesday.

item.title: iHeart Podcast UnionのメンバーがiHeartMediaに対して不当労働行為を申し立て。
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / The Hollywood Reporter:
Members of the iHeart Podcast Union file an unfair labor practice claim against iHeartMedia; the union represents around 100 producers, hosts, and others  —  Staffers who are unionized with the Writers Guild of America East are alleging that management has engaged in intimidating behavior …

item.title: コロンビア大学の独立系学生新聞「コロンビア・デイリー・スペクテイター」は、イスラエルとハマスの戦争をめぐる緊迫した抗議行動をどのように報道しているか（Tom Jones/Poynter）
item.description:
Tom Jones / Poynter:
How the Columbia Daily Spectator, the independent student newspaper of Columbia University, is covering the tense protests over the Israel-Hamas war  —  The Columbia Daily Spectator has expertly documented tense protests over the Israel-Hamas war inside and outside the campus.

item.title: 積極的なインタビューのおかげでMSNBCの番組に出演することができたメフディ・ハサンのプロフィールを紹介。
item.description:
E. Alex Jung / New York Magazine:
A profile of Mehdi Hasan, whose aggressive interviewing helped him get an MSNBC show, as he now embraces the “canceled” label to launch his Zeteo substack  —  Mehdi Hasan's aggressive interviewing style landed him a Sunday show on MSNBC.  Until he started talking about Palestine.

item.title: 上院が79対18で可決、下院は4月20日に360対58で可決したByteDance-TikTok離脱・禁止法案に署名するバイデン大統領（Lauren Feiner/The Verge）
item.description:
Lauren Feiner / The Verge:
President Biden signs the ByteDance-TikTok divest-or-ban bill into law, after the Senate passed it by 79-18; the House passed the legislation 360-58 on April 20  —  The divest-or-ban bill is now law, starting the clock for ByteDance to make its move.  The company has an initial nine months …

item.title: メタ、グーグル、スナップ、アマゾンはすべて米国のTikTok禁止から利益を得ている。マーク・ザッカーバーグは2019年、メタの広範なキャンペーンの一環として、TikTokの中国ルーツを批判した（Will Oremus/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Will Oremus / Washington Post:
Meta, Google, Snap, and Amazon all benefit from the US TikTok ban; Mark Zuckerberg criticized TikTok's Chinese roots in 2019, part of Meta's broader campaign  —  Meta has struggled for years to fend off TikTok.  Now Meta and Google are poised to reap the rewards of a potential ban.

item.title: 聴衆の減少、スポンサー収入の減少、事態の好転をめぐる内部対立、多様性の推進など、NPRの苦悩を情報筋が詳述（New York Times紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources detail NPR's struggles with declining audiences, falling sponsorship revenue, internal conflicts over turning things around, and a diversity push  —  NPR employees tuned in for a pivotal meeting late last year for a long-awaited update on the future of the public radio network.

item.title: TikTokが禁止されようがされまいが、広告主、クリエイター、スタッフの不確実性により集中力を失う可能性のあるこの赤字アプリにとっては、これで終わりとなる（M.G. Siegler/Spyglass）
item.description:
M.G. Siegler / Spyglass:
Whether TikTok is banned or not, this is the end as we know it for the loss-making app, which may lose focus due to advertiser, creator, and staff uncertainty  —  The tok is tiking... Later today, President Biden will sign a bill which, among other things, will put TikTok on the clock.

item.title: NPRを擁護し、憲法修正第1条に関する彼女の過去の発言に対する批判者の「悪意ある歪曲」を非難するNPRのキャサリン・マーCEOへのインタビュー（Alexandra Bruell/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Alexandra Bruell / Wall Street Journal:
An interview with NPR CEO Katherine Maher, who defends NPR and accuses critics of “bad faith distortion” of her past comments about the First Amendment  —  Katherine Maher said controversy stemming from an editor's essay criticizing the radio network has been a distraction
